Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jan K
Reviews.Content: I have to say, the staff named "Kirsi" was extremely helpful. We only stayed there for 2 nights and she helped us by sharing info on how we can maximize our time in Barcelona. She even drew an outline on the map putting bus numbers, nearest metro. Exceptional work! The hotel was neat and nice. I have to say, WiFi signal at the ground room where we were at was stable. Location is close to Sagrada Familia and near to some attractions. If you plan to get that hop-on-hop-off tour, the station of Blue bus is also just a few minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A budget-priced gem”
Reviews.Author: monkey2000
Reviews.Content: After my plan to stay with a friend fell through at the last minute, I wound up staying at the Hostemplo. Very lucky. It was during a big conference and every room in town was booked or the prices were well into the 200-300 euro level, something my budget could not accomodate. I jumped on Kayak to search and was clicking through to TripAdvisor to check reviews when Hostemplo popped up. I found out later thay had just posted the room after a cancellation. It was a little further out than I normally like to stay but the price was right and the reviews were promising. I was happy to find the place bright, clean and newly renovated. The management were super nice and helpful and professional. Unlike many smaller hotels there was no issue about coming and going 24 hours thanks to the security card system. Free coffee and juice. The room itself was tiny but very well laid out. Bright and clean and everything new. There was a bottle of water and a few chocolates on the bed waiting for me. A flat screen television. Small desk and chair. I had a single so it was a twin bed but nice linens and very comfortable. The bath room is small but well thought out. The glass door could be an issue if you are sharing. WIFI worked great so I could work done from my room. Would've liked a few more outlets to charge my iPad and mobile at same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hostel”
Reviews.Author: Andrei R
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights in room 16 on the first floor. The room was extremely clean, rather small but functional. The bathroom doesn't have a proper door, it's only a glass door that leaves little to imagination regarding the actions of the person inside. If you are traveling as a newly dating couple (or not a couple at all) it might be a bit awkward and uncomfortable. There was a WIFI connection that worked great the entire stay. It was rather cold outside during our stay but the AC managed beautifully to keep us warm. The hostel in indeed located just a couple of blocks away from Sagrada Familia and the metro station but it's a bit far from Rambla and Plaza Catalunya. They're a 25-30 min walk or a 20 min metro ride away. There are a couple nice restaurants and cafes nearby and not very expensive. There is free coffee and orange juice in the lobby. I would recommend it to anyone who doesn't want to do a lot of sightseeing (the commute to the city center is rather annoying).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but useless WiFi”
Reviews.Author: ackelid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in room 26 on the second floor. The location is not bad, just two blocks away from the wonderful Sagrada Familia and with good Subway connection to the city center. The rooms are small but functional and very clean. The beds are OK and we had a good sleep most nights. Some traffic noise could be heard which could be a problem for the light sleeper. There was no breakfast, but there are several good places for breakfast in the surroundings. The hotel offers free coffee of very good quality in the lobby. And now the negative point: When we select hotels, a good WiFi connection in the room is absolutely essential. The WiFi at Hostemplo was out of order most of the time and the staff did not care very much to solve the problem. The rating "2" is based on the fact that we payed for WiFI but we didn't get WiFi. Apart from the non-existing WiFi, we consider the hotel good value for money (rating "4"). We recommend Hostemplo for people who do not need WiFi. If you need WiFi, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Daniella S
Reviews.Content: Even staying in the ground floor, we do not had problems neither with reception nor street noises. The room is very well decorated, new and clean. The bathroom is very nice also. It's located near the Sagrada Familia (10 min walking), with lots of shops, restaurants and metro station. Besidestelling in the site that there is a breakfast, it is limited to coffee and chips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JodieMC70
Reviews.Content: Whilst it is not in the heart of Barcelona this hotel is round the corner from Sagrada Familia and near the railway staion. It is beautifully maintained, clean and functional. We were surprised by the large size of our room considering this was the budget accommodation. Downside was the lack of quality restaurants in the local area and staff did not make any recommendations. Rooms were quiet and sleep came easy - just what you want after an exhausting sight seeing day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pearceppp
Reviews.Content: We had requested 3 singles but on arrival on the 7th October, we had a double and a twin. The woman on reception phoned the boss and they arranged an extra bed straight away from another hotel as all of the rooms were full. When I called back to the room to collect something, the receptionist called me over and gave me an envelope with Euros in it as compensation, even though we never requested it. That's what I call great customer service, and I highly recommend them just on that basis alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: SavyTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked Hostemplo for a 6 night stay. The rooms were modern, and very clean. The housekeeping staff mopped the hardwood floors daily, and the room was generally spotless. We found that the thick windows did a superb job of keeping noise out, though it may have been less noisy since we were on the second floor. We had a great time. It's about a 5 min walk to the Sagrada Familia and access to the Metro line. Only down point was that the air conditioner in our room died on the last night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice room, but can get noisey”
Reviews.Author: Anon773
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 5 days. Room is a great value, but the walls are thin so you can hear everything going on outside, which can get kind of loud. I was on the floor right above the lobby, so I can hear conversations that were going on in the front desk. Location is a 5 minute walk to Sagrada Familia and public transportation, and 20 minute walk to Casa Mila and Casa Batllo. There's also a couple grocery stores nearby in case you need water, food, etc. Overall, great value but can get noisey.

Reviews.Title: “nice deal for staying Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: pppeko
Reviews.Content: Room: not very large but spacious. Very clean. Bathroom: much larger than other hotel in the same level. Nice design that water won't splash out. Staff :very helpful and sweet. They prepare honeymoon gift for us. Location: about 3 minutes walk to Sagaria Familia (to the metro it takes about 5 minutes). If you want you can also walk to Casa Batllo, it takes about 30 minutes. This area is very safe and looks like a resident area. The supermarket next to the hostal offer water in a very nice price. Although this is not the most luxury hotel I've stayed but they are the most lovely hotel. They even prepare juice, chips, tea bags and hot water for free in front of the reception desk. Also, WiFi runs smoothly. It'll be better if there is a safety box in the room. But you can leave important staff to the staff in reception. They are accountable and nice. Btw the light in bathroom turns on by movement, so if you keep taking shower for a while without movement, the light will automatically turn off. It's a little bit annoying but not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Simple room but very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: neverenoughtravel73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hostal Hostemplo in September on a solo trip to Barcelona. it was in a good location with an excellent little cafe across the street that serves cheap and good European Breakfast. I stayed in the single room which was very small and had one twin bed. But the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was in the room with a shower. The room had a safe, cable TV and a window that opened onto the street. I was surprised that at the front desk both the English and French was limited which made trip planning a bit more complicated (but then again I was in Catalan country so should not have been so bold to expect to be spoken to in English or French!!). I would totally stay here again when I go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: SrtaYount
Reviews.Content: After staying in several hostals throughout Northern Spain, I can say without a doubt that this hostal is the best of the best. We were more than satisfied with the service and cleanliness. The manager and staff were extremely helpful. The rooms are absolutely beautiful and well equipped with modern conveniences. We stayed in the Hotel the first night in Barcelona, left to go to Bilbao, and then returned another night and stayed in the Apartments. Both were equally as nice. The apartments would be perfect for a couple or family staying in the city for several nights. My only suggestion is that if you have never stayed in a hostel or hostal, then you need to know that it is not like staying in a regular hotel. There is no guarantee that rooms will be "quiet" or "roomy." I have read several complaints regarding these two points. We didn't have a problem with either of these issues at all. One shouldn't expect to travel anywhere in Europe and have a large room -- especially not in a hostal/hostel. However, if you appreciate clean rooms, good service, and modern conveniences at a reasonable price, then this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, nice clean room”
Reviews.Author: Remi6180
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hostemplo for three days in February and had a nice, comfortable stay. The room was small but clean and had been recently refurbished. Facilities were basic but very good. We'd asked for a first floor room based on feedback we'd read. Definitely something to bear in mind as the ground floor is right by a busy road and large bins that get emptied early in the morning. The location is great for Sagrada Familia and Gracia. Buses and metro within easy reach. If you get the free breakfast option, don't use the Cheques Gourmet in the recommended bar but go to any other bar or bakery with the sign on the door and get more for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mirmasmith
Reviews.Content: It would have been nice to have a small fridge in the room. The air conditionning is a bit noisy and the area is calm and peaceful. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than others have said it is!”
Reviews.Author: ETNPortland
Reviews.Content: Just two blocks from the Sagrada Familia (thoughtfully consecrated by the Pope during my visit), the biggest surprise (and there are NO negatives) is the location less than a block from the Diagonal, and convenient to all modes of public transportation and walking distance to many central attractions. Plenty of small markets and bakeries to fashion a meal any time of day or evening. While the hotel has wi-fi, there is an internet "cafe" very near where the fee is only 1 Euro per hour! The complete remodel of this small corner building is tasteful and efficient. Terrific shower and bathroom. Well sound-proofed, too! Carlos, the owner-manager who oversaw all of the design and rebuilding, is a fine host. Couldn't ask for a better or nicer "tourist" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel near Sagrada Familia Church”
Reviews.Author: gdoll
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel located in a decent area, but the underground transit is still needed to go over to la rambla and older culture area of Barcelona. The cost was good at about 99 Euro a nite. I would have recomended the hotel to a friend, but the rooms are very small, and the location could be better. Good beds. Newly remodelled and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: YMC59
Reviews.Content: The small hotel is conveniently located and very easy to get to using the train and metro system from the airport. The instructions on their website was very easy to follow. The hotel is small and intimate. The room we were in was contemporary, modest and clean. The bathroom is also simple but nicely appointed. The owner of the hotel is not always there, but we contacted him with our arrival time, and he made sure he was there to receive us. We booked our room through Expedia at a lower rate than we actually paid, but Expedia was not very cooperative and seemed unable to explain or rectify the difference, which left us thinking we should have just booked directly. However, even with the slightly higher charge, we thought it was good value, and were very happy with our stay at Hostemplo.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for $$”
Reviews.Author: sae019
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night post cruise in November. The location is excellent - just blocks away from the Sagrada Familia but also in a more non-touristy section of the neighborhood. The room was large enough and very clean, and the staff very nice. The only complaint is that it gets pretty loud and bright outside at night if you are a light sleeper. Also, there are no English language channels on the TV. We would definitely stay again as it's a great value for how much we paid, especially with the Pope in town that day.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: jzgreens
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 2 blocks from the Sagrada Familia (which is also a metro stop). No 24 hour service, but secure door. Room is small, but comfortable. Bathroom is great. Looking for a great deal (not needing any bells and whistles), you've found the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and welcoming, shame about the noise outside”
Reviews.Author: billsown
Reviews.Content: Booked this small hotel based on reviews in Trip Advisor and was not disappointed in arrival. The owner and receptionist were welcoming. The room was modern, stylish, and comfortable. Unfortunately, it was positioned next to the traffic lights at a city junction. Not a big problem as the traffic died down after midnight BUT the City Fathers of Barcelona have chosen to position 4 rubbish bins in front and it is their practice to empty them in the wee small hours. Each is for recycling a different type of rubbish and therefore each has to be emptied at a different time. You've just got to sleep and then .....Such a shame!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: csteen
Reviews.Content: No frills. Modern. Small rooms. Well located just a couple of blocks from Sagrada Familia and the metro. Owner could use some lessons in hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, stylish, quiet and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: KickingKate
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, everything very modern, new and clean. Room on a busy street but never noisy at night, even in the middle of La Merce festival! Really handy for Sagrada Familia, and just a 3 minute walk from the Metro Station, so the rest of the city was very accessible. Very friendly staff, great value for money. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean”
Reviews.Author: liz-bailey
Reviews.Content: Was easy to get the tube from the airport to the hotel which is really close to the Sanga Familiar. Was checked in by a 12 year old boy (who we thought might be the lovely Carlos we had heard so much about) whose English was very good. The room was beautiful and clean, it was my birthday and they had put some lovely flowers in the room for us. The air con and shower was good, was a bit worried about the glass fronted shower as travelling with a friend but its really well designed so dont worry about that. The hotel is about 10-15 min walk from the main square. There aren't many restaurants around the hotel area so best to go into the centre. We did the hop on hop off bus tour which was well worth the money. When buying a subway ticket you can get a 10 journey one which can be used for more than one person, just go through the barrier and hand it back to whoever your travelling with. I've been to quite a few European cities and I would say Barcelona is my favourite, there's so much to do, we were flat out for 2 and a half days and there's still lots to go back for.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Markjordan
Reviews.Content: Booked this on the back of reviews here and wasn't disappointed. Slightly suprised to be checked in by the owners son who couldn't be much more than 11 but he was polite and efficient! The room (14) was spotlessly clean and, contrary to previous reviews questioning double glazing, was double glazed and quiet for a city room facing a fairly busy junction. I am the world's lightest / worst sleeper and I found it pleasantly quiet and the bed comfortable. Our request for extra pillows was sorted immediately. As previously mentioned the bathroom is separated from the bedroom by partly opaque glass and a sliding door, so doesn't leave much to the imagination in terms of sight nor sound. If you're newly together or faint hearted this may not be for you. It caused us much hilarity though and we discovered our singing voices!!! Location wise, its 200m from the amazing Segrada Familia where you can pick up tube or Tour Bus. (The tube puts London's to shame - incredibly clean, security patrolled and air conditioned. Cheap too at 72c per trip). It's a good 20 minute stroll into the city and be sure to take a street map. Barcelona is built on a grid system and many roads and junctions look the same so very easy to get lost on foot. Taxis were reasonable though. At 85e per night for the double room it was terrific vale for money; no frills but we were only there to sleep and shower. The air con was a blessing given that it hit 40c while we were there which is well above the 30 - 32c norm. Great stay; couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: lucyq
Reviews.Content: Horrible mattres, noisy air conditioning, quite far from the metro in a quite empty area. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “We spent 3 nights in Aug '10 in...”
Reviews.Author: jamesandsophie
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Aug '10 in Hostemplo. Based on previous reviews we had high hopes and were not disappointed. The rooms are exactly as the pictures portray & are spotless & cleaned thoroughly every day. We arrived to find extra towels, bottled water & chocolates on our bed. The air-con is highly efficient (especially in August!) & is free of charge. The hotel is in the perfect position for a city break, 2 mins walk to the epic Sagrada Familia & the Metro Stop to everywhere else. There are supermarkets, pharmacies, bars & restaurants near by & the manager & staff are always happy to help with any situation that may arise. All in all we highly recommend this hotel & look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE "ME ENCANTA" Hostal Hostemplo”
Reviews.Author: Profesoraklv
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 4 different rooms out of 10 at this hostal, due to our varied comings and goings, and they were all wonderful. FREE WIFI in a hostal ?! I had my MacBook and the WiFi worked great, which was almost as important as the A/C (which also was excellent). Room 16 with a little balconcito is particularly nice for a couple. Carlos and his family were so kind to me...after more than staying one week I missed my flight out of BCN and they were so sweet about making arrangements, helping with taxis, umbrellas, waking me up, etc. I am verrryy picky, this hostal is very clean and new, the air condicioning works great (very important) and I would definitely recommend this place - I LOVE it and the owners - and plan to come back next year. Gracias Carlos y familia :) xo

Reviews.Title: “Loved the details”
Reviews.Author: beigecanadian
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it's the little things that make a place great. When we arrived exhausted to hostal hostemplo, we were greeted with bottles of water and chocolates sitting on the bed and the towels were wrapped in sprigs of lavender! The room was very clean with a contemporary design. Only drawback was that the washroom was glass, so you could see everything - however, the shower was great! Also, our room was on the ground floor right beside the street, so we didn't open the curtains. Other than that, we loved our stay here. Location is pretty decent. Close to Passeig de Gracia. Had a great sleep, bed and pillows were very comfortable. Would stay here again for it's amazing value.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal Hostemplo
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Sicilia 276, 08013 Barcelona, Spain
